column4: I'm trying to manually configure my eth0 interface…but getting some error. http://pastebin.com/yxjZ6YTP
I've provided error and my /etc/network/interfaces file
why are you not using network manager ?
do you have an eth0 device ?
youre gateway is unreachable
remove the gateway line and try it
perfect…error gone. But now while ping 8.8.8.8, its saying unknown host
because you won't have a route out
you need to use a valid gateway
don't uncomment the gateway, it's unreachable, it will never work
the network needs to be 1.0 AND the gateway line needs to be valid
is this a guest or the host ?
ok - so you are putting the guest on 192.168.1.X network, your gateway is 192.168.2.1 - 1.X cannot see 2.1
that is how it's meant to work
that is correct, it should not be able to see 192.168.2.1
bridge mode bridges the physical devices, not the ip layer
get it ?
no problem, glad it clicked

nothing stupid about it, virtual networking is complex
